results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Angelica Mesiti, Bridget Ikin, Jodie Passmore and Felix Media
results.credit_line:
Angelica Mesiti
Three channel video installation, digital video, sound, 35:36 mins.
Ian Potter Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection
Courtesy the artist and Anna Schwartz Gallery
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, three channel video, projection, colour and audio.
results.brief_description:
‘The Calling’ is a three-channel video installation that focuses on whistling languages, ancient forms of non-verbal communication which are still used in 2013 to communicate in isolated and difficult landscapes.

To conduct research for ‘The Calling’, artist Angelica Mesiti travelled to the village of Kuskoy in Northern Turkey, the island of La Gomera in The Canary Islands and the Island of Evia in Greece where whistling languages are all still in use.

For these communities, whistling languages are in a process of transformation from their traditional use as tools for communication across vast lands into tourist attractions and cultural artefacts and are being taught to local school children.

‘The Calling’ is a poignant exploration of ancient human traditions evolving and adapting to the modern world. The work speaks to the tenacity and creativity of traditional cultures in the face of globalisation, technological progress and environmental flux.

Angelica Mesiti was the winner of the inaugural Ian Potter Moving Image Commission.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Angelica Mesiti, Bridget Ikin, Jodie Passmore and Felix Media

results.title: The Lost Thing
results.creator_credit: Andrew Ruhemann, Shaun Tan, Leo Baker, Sophie Byrne and Passion Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in a city overrun by bureaucracy, this Oscar Award winning animated short film of Shaun Tan’s picture book ‘The Lost Thing’, tells the story of a boy who befriends a strange creature that doesn’t appear to fit in any of the available pigeonholes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Ruhemann, Shaun Tan, Leo Baker, Sophie Byrne and Passion Pictures

results.title: Peter
results.creator_credit: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Channel 4, Cowboy Films, Film London and Fresh One Productions
results.brief_description: In a semi-empty swimming pool Peter engages in a series of very intense warming up and breathing exercises. He stretches, flexes, inhales and exhales to finally plunge in the water and re-emerges fully satisfied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Channel 4, Cowboy Films, Film London and Fresh One Productions

results.title: The Estate
results.creator_credit: Caswell Coggins, Toby Conway-Hughes, Mike Carr, Balletboyz, Channel 4 and Crossfire
results.brief_description: A short dance piece set in an English housing estate. The choreography is loosely based on the idea of vultures circling a dying animal, feeling their excitement and anticipation as they gather to feed, waiting for the moment to strike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Caswell Coggins, Toby Conway-Hughes, Mike Carr, Balletboyz, Channel 4 and Crossfire

results.title: Acts of Kindness
results.creator_credit: Michael Landy, Pinky Ghundale, Channel 4 and Film London
results.brief_description: A celebration of everyday acts of kindness that happen on London Underground every day of the year. The film originated from ‘Acts of Kindness’, a project by Michael Landy for London Underground, commissioned by Art on the Underground, London Underground Limited, 2011-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Landy, Pinky Ghundale, Channel 4 and Film London

results.title: Robots of Brixton
results.creator_credit: Kibwe Tavares, Channel 4 and Factory Fifteen
results.brief_description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.
results.description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.

results.title: Mozart's House
results.creator_credit: Jack Patterson, Channel 4 and Clean Film
results.brief_description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.
results.description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.
